ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would absolutely recommend this class to another student.

This is an excellent course. Professor Malvesti is a total expert and a wonderful instructor. You will learn a lot about the National Security Council system, as well as different theories of how we make decisions individually and in group settings. A must-take!
I would definitely recommend it -- the workload is manageable, the subject is fascinating, and the professor is great.
Highly recommend. This is a great course taught by a great professor.
Useful for understanding basic decision-making theories with respect to U.S. national security.Yes.
I would recommend this class for people who are interested in security related internships and jobs and also anyone generally interested in international relations.
This course is very helpful for anyone interested in how decisions are made, with emphasis on senior level American security decisions.
As above, would definitely recommend this class to others.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course definitely deepened my understanding of the subject matter.
As an Army officer, I'm tasked to implement parts of national strategy, it is helpful to see how decisions on these strategies are made.
It helped me to understand the decision making process and the various theories. Very good overview.

Course filled in the gaps in my personal knowledge and made me more informed on the mechanics of the national security infrastructure. I believe it will be helpful over the long-term in my professional career.
